00031   const char *help_text_contents[] = {
00032     "",
00033     "mkdir ............. Creates a directory in Hyperspace",
00034     "delete .............Delete file/directory",
00035     "open .............. Open a file/directory",
00036     "create ............ Create a file",
00037     "close ............. Close previously opened file/directory",
00038     "attrset ........... Set an attribute (key/value pair) for a file/directory",
00039     "attrget ........... Retrieve an attribute for a file/directory",
00040     "attrdel ........... Delete an attribure for a file/directory",
00041     "exists ............ Check if a file/directory exists",
00042     "readdir ........... List the contents of a previously opened directory",
00043     "lock .............. Lock access to a file/directory",
00044     "trylock ........... Check whether a lock on file/directory would succeed",
00045     "release ........... Release previously acquired lock",
00046     "getseq ............ Get a lock sequencer for a file/directory",
00047     "echo .............. Echo user input",
00048     "",
00049     "Statements must be terminated with ';' to execute.  For more information on",
00050     "a specific statement, type 'help <statement>', where <statement> is one from",
00051     "the preceeding list.",
00052     "",
00053     0
00054   };

00069     "open <fname> flags=[READ|WRITE|LOCK|CREATE|EXCL|TEMP|LOCK_SHARED|LOCK_EXCLUSIVE] [event-mask=<mask>]",
00070     "  This command issues an OPEN request to Hyperspace.  The optional",
00071     "  parameter event-mask may take a value that is the combination of",
00072     "  the following strings:",
00073     "    ATTR_SET|ATTR_DEL|CHILD_NODE_ADDED|CHILD_NODE_REMOVED|LOCK_ACQUIRED|LOCK_RELEASED",

00077   const char *help_create[] = {
00078     "create <fname> flags=[READ|WRITE|LOCK|TEMP|LOCK_SHARED|LOCK_EXCLUSIVE] [OPTIONS]",
00079     "OPTIONS:",
00080     "  attr:<name>=<value>  This can be used to specify extended attributes that should",
00081     "                       get created atomically when the file is created",
00082     "  event-mask=<mask>  This indicates which events should be delivered on this handle.",
00083     "                     The <mask> value can take any combination of the following:",
00084     "                     ATTR_SET|ATTR_DEL|LOCK_ACQUIRED|LOCK_RELEASED",
00085     "  This command issues an CREATE request to Hyperspace.",

00152   typedef Hypertable::hash_map<std::string, const char **>  HelpTextMap;
00153 
00154   HelpTextMap &build_help_text_map() {
00155     HelpTextMap *map = new HelpTextMap();
00156     (*map)[""] = help_text_contents;
00157     (*map)["mkdir"] = help_mkdir;
00158     (*map)["delete"] = help_delete;
00159     (*map)["open"] = help_open;
00160     (*map)["create"] = help_create;
00161     (*map)["close"] = help_close;
00162     (*map)["attrset"] = help_attrset;
00163     (*map)["attrget"] = help_attrget;
00164     (*map)["attrdel"] = help_attrdel;
00165     (*map)["exists"] = help_exists;
00166     (*map)["readdir"] = help_readdir;
00167     (*map)["lock"] = help_lock;
00168     (*map)["trylock"] = help_trylock;
00169     (*map)["release"] = help_release;
00170     (*map)["getseq"] = help_getsequencer;
00171     return *map;
00172   }
00173 
00174   HelpTextMap &text_map = build_help_text_map();
00175 }
00176 
00177 
00178 const char **HsHelpText::get(const std::string &subject) {
00179   HelpTextMap::const_iterator iter = text_map.find(subject);
00180   if (iter == text_map.end())
00181     return 0;
00182   return (*iter).second;
00183 }
